title: Over the Ocean; or, Sights and Scenes in Foreign Lands
author: Guild, Curtis
snippet: Watling Street, a narrow lane, but oldas Anglo-Saxon times; Newgate, where the old walls of London stood, isnear at hand, and Cannon Street, which runs into St. Paul's churchyard,contains the old London Stone, once called the central point of thecity, from which distances were measured; Ludgate Hill, little narrowPaternoster Row, Cheapside, and Old Bailey are close by, and a few stepswill take you into Fleet Street, St. Martins le Grand, or Bow Lane.

title: A bachelor's rambles through the British Isles.
author: Butler, Charles J.
snippet: down to St. Martins street; from there to Westminster Bridge.
